Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Stayed At.....”
Reviews.Author: mdgtfrmhll
Reviews.Content: My mother, son and I took a chance on this hotel as it was in the right location. Upon arriving at the hotel the amount of vagrants hanging out in front should have been an indicator of how highly rated the hotel was. The gentlemen at the check in counter was very pleasant and allowed me to park my car there so that we could spend the day at Universal Studios and take the train over. The location of the hotel was perfect. Just a short walk to Hollywood/Highland were we were able to catch a train for $1.50 for adults and $.25 cents for seniors. Can't beat that deal. By the time we got back to the hotel we were exhausted and checked in pretty quickly. The guy at the front desk again was very pleasant. The room was nothing to write home about. The TV reception was not great, there were rings in the sink and bathtub and it was a bare bones hotel, but we knew this going in. We just needed a place to rest our heads and get some sleep. This is where it got bad. Turns out that we were placed right between a couple of rooms that decided it would be great to stay up and fight all night. Between the yelling and slamming of doors it was almost impossible to sleep. A call to the front desk was of no help. Obviously the two gentlemen that I had encountered earlier in the day had gone home and been replaced by someone who just didn't seem to care. He gave me an obligatory, "I'll see what I can do." He obviously couldn't do much because for at least another two hours the same cycle went on. This was exactly the same with our second night, only this night we got an added in guitar playing drunk who couldn't carry a tune for the life of him. Calls to the front desk again did no good. I guess it stands to reason we will not be staying here again. Maybe this is for you, but it wasn't my idea of a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RyanL10
Reviews.Content: We stayed just after it had been recently renovated. The rooms were not bad and service was OK too, the only thing I didn't like was the parking. They have a small parking lot below the hotel with a valet attendant, because if there are too many cars they will just park them anywhere they fit so you have to leave the keys. The motel is right next to Hollywood Blvd though and you can walk to anything there, but Hollywood itself is nothing special. There are more bums on that road alone than I've seen on the strip in Vegas. But for the hotel, I would stay here if you're looking to visit Hollywood / LA on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Hollywood Sights”
Reviews.Author: Gadfly1
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, relatively quiet and very convenient motel, especially if you do not have a car. It is between two stops on the Red Line light rail (Hollywood & Vine and Hollywood & Highland). There is a market about 2 blocks away from the motel. The neighborhood appeared relatively safe to walk around in even in the early hours of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely rude oriental reception staff”
Reviews.Author: deandonline
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel,having reserved the room some weeks previously to find that they had sold the room for more money and consequently did not have any other rooms. The car parking staff were ignorant,however the Oriental receptionist was about the worse receptionist I have ever encountered across several continents and many different countries. I complained to Motel 6, at their head office. They were not much use. They offered empty platitudes. They told me it was a franchised location. My advice,when in Los Angeles avoid this one and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “R & R”
Reviews.Author: panderingpimp
Reviews.Content: very good location in the heart of hollywood very clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Not even worth saving money on”
Reviews.Author: Robyn H
Reviews.Content: When I checked in there was very little parking, thank goodness I was able to park in Handicap because I am but the next day I was blocked in and couldn't leave. Checking in I was given 2 double beds because they had no king bed available even though I made reservations and the people in front of me hadn't. Then I was told I would have to switch room by 9am because of construction. Had I know about the construction going on I would not have booked this hotel. I got up early so I could switch rooms and what do you know nothing available and had to wait several hours to get a room. The person at the front desk did not offer to allow me to stay in the room I had until one was available and with my car blocked in I was stuck there. By the time I got my room it was too late for me to go to where I planned because of time. Then that night the room next to me had people screaming, kids yelling and doors slamming starting around 7pm. When I called the front desk after 10:30 pm they said they would talk to them. Then at 2:30am that same room was yelling and slamming doors. When I checked out the front desk did not seem to care nor acknowledge anything. Even though it was a cheap hotel I would rather spend an extra $50 somewhere else. There was no flip lock on the door and there was an inch gap under the door and the refridge barely worked and this was the "newly remodeled room". The tv only had about 10 channels and half of them were fuzzy.

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget and location minded travelers”
Reviews.Author: georgebird
Reviews.Content: The good: Location Location Location Free Wifi Decent shower Excellent price The bad: Apathetic staff Fee for parking On the whole, it's great for budget minded travelers who aren't expecting much other than a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: RobWinmar
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel for its combination of location and reasonable price. It's close to Hollywood Boulevard and the area with Kodak Theatre etc is not far away on foot. We didn't have a car with us, but there is parking underneath the motel for $10 per day. Our room had two beds, which was great, and we had a comfortable sleep. The toiletries provided are a bit light on - average soap and no shampoo - but if you're staying in lots of hotels like we were you probably have enough from elsewhere. There is a laundry off the foyer, which proved very useful. The only disappointing thing was the internet signal. It was fine in the foyer, but abysmal in our room. The room was only about three from the elevators at the street side of the floor, but we still couldn't connect without standing outside the elevators or sitting in the lobby. There is a computer room/business centre on the ground floor though, for those who don't have their own computers. Finally, people who walked in off the street and asked for a room were charged a lot more than we were online, so beware of this if you haven't already made a booking. It's worth staying here if you can get a decent deal online and don't mind sitting in the foyer to access the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, good location, does the job”
Reviews.Author: Shazzadude
Reviews.Content: This place is nothing fancy, but serves it's purpose, was much cheaper than other places in Hollywood and is well located just off Hollywood Blvd. They also let you store your bags in their office after you've check out (my flight back home wasn't until the evening).I'd stay again no worries.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: jenny a
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE IS SCARY. DO NOT STAY HERE. Left in the middle of the night because we were so afraid. Someone broken into the room while we were gone. The front desk did not do anything about it and tried to charge us $150.00 for it because of the damage the person left.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnthroTeacher
Reviews.Content: December 2011 - Bed Bugs! Entire boy, including face, was bitten by bed bugs. The rash, boils, and incessant itching caused nausea and insomnia. Bed bugs invaded suitcase and were involuntarily brought into car! NIGHTMARE.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Crusaders
Reviews.Content: As stated by many people a good clean budget place to stay. Handy to the subway and I feel a good central place to base yourself, I stayed for 4 nights and have no complaints value for money @ $60 a night The homeless must have moved out of the area as I didn't see any hanging around I felt perfectly safe walking outside at night (I traveled alone this trip) Stayed on level 2 overlooking alley and neighbouring building no problems with noise All in all I would miss LA all together but if I did return I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Worttyh it”
Reviews.Author: vlvania
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money. Perfect location for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Big Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: cmglin
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big and clean. It's in a great location and the they can help with any tours ect..

Reviews.Title: “170 steps to Hollywood Blvd!”
Reviews.Author: Hot-Tati
Reviews.Content: This was a serious low budget trip for us. We went to Hollywood to get some costume wigs and outfits on Hollywood Blvd. I found this hotel after reading a suggestion by another trip advisor. This location is 170 steps from Hollywood Blvd! This is a no frills, super self service hotel. We arrived about 7 pm. The hotel is situated in a residential area and its a reasonably safe area. There was a few people outside smoking, as they have no smoking rooms at this location. When I walked in I was 3 rd in line. Got checked in quickly. We had to pay $10.00 for parking and that was not mentioned anywhere that I saw when I booked our reservations for 4 nights. Our room for Wednesday and Thursday was less than $70.00 each night. We had to park our car in the underground parking garage. Its a super tight fit. So if your in an SUV, forget it! We were told it was VALET, not so. Unless my understanding of VALET is wrong. Anyway we found a spot in the corner to park. *(See photos). We then got the luggage cart from the parking attendant who is not actually a VALET guy...loaded our stuff and took it to the elevator., We were assigned a room on the 4th floor. There is one elevator to service the 5 floor hotel and the garage. Plus a set of stairs. We were assigned room 425. It was the second to the last room on the floor. I was ok with this cuz then we did not get so much walk by noise. We opened the door and it is what it is. A very basic, clean room, no frills. We had asked for 2 queens but were given a king. I could deal with this. Not a huge issue. The bathroom is very basic. The water pressure in the shower and sink was really good. No matter what time of day we used them. Hot water came quickly. Linens are super white, clean and fresh in the bath. There is a basic set up but also a fridge which was nice as we brought water and used it for leftovers. Our window faced an apartment building. decent view, There was no liner or sheers, so if you opened the curtains, they were open to the view of the neighbors. The bedding is pretty basic, again no frills. There was an ironing board and iron in room. I had to go to the front desk for the blow drier and for shampoo. No conditioner is provided. The Ice Machine, Vending Machines, and Laundry are all located on the main floor only. That was good excercise for me as I am an Ice fanatic and have to have a lot of it , frequently. I was going up and down constantly for ice. But hey it beats having to buy bags of it. The TV had poor reception, but we were not here to watch TV. So again, another thing I could over look. So once we got settled, I took a nap, It was about 10 or so when we got up and out to Hollywood Blvd. It is seriously so close to the Blvd that it was the perfect place for us to stay. Also , since we were shopping at the best wig shop on the Blvd, we could walk to it too. There are several bars, clubs and places to eat in such close proximity. If you are a group of people or just a couple, this is a great location. I have to say this was so good for us as I sleep a lot, and anytime I needed a nap it was easy to go back to the room. This is such a convenient location. But if you are a pampered traveler, do not expect Ceasers treatment here. It is a basic room with a bed and shower. thats what you are getting here. Bring a candle or plug in air freshner with you if damp smell bothers you. And pack your sleeping mask if your sensitive to the light. A thermos that holds lots of ice is a good idea so your not running up and down all the time getting ice. Drive a small car or use a shuttle. * Currently doing remodeling on 5th floor, so you share the elevator with the workers, construction people as well as hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “the best location of hotel in Hollywood Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: shishirsukant
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling to LA this is just the place u r looking for . it is an absolute value for money. me and my wife found that whatever was worth seeing in Hollywood was at a 5 minute walk from this hotel. The staff were very helpful and arranged for a day trip of the LA downtown on just one little call. although u might find the Metro another convenient option to roam around the city , for going to the Universal city or downtown. There is an excellent grocery store right at the corner where u can find almost anything that u might need. but remember this is a motel and u are taking a room here to sleep not for anything else. Happy holidays . shishir

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel, 4 stars for location and value”
Reviews.Author: nathsal
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat this motel for location in Hollywood, it is so close to the kodak and Chinese theatres and all the action. The motel is what it is, nothing special but hey, you only sleep there. Our room was a good size with king size bed, excellent air con, fridge and a clean bathroom. The motel feels more like a hostel but not in a bad way, it has free coffee in the morning, vending machines and also laundry facilities which is great if you are on a long trip. There were lots of young europeans who had been to the mini-mart on the corner and were in the lobby making sandwiches each morning - a great way to save money in LA if you are on a budget. We would recommend it if you know what to expect and we will definitely stay again if back in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: kvg3879
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to the price and location. You should definitely book in advance as it was full when we were there (we toured around and no other hotels were full). It's in a really good location where you can walk to a number of sights. Other reviews mention lots of homeless people but we didn't see any and whilst it obviously isn't the nicest of areas we didn't feel at all threatened or worried and certainly did not see anyone with a gun let alone a security man toting a gun as one review says. The rooms are worn and this is obviously a back packers hotel but it was clean enough and cheap compared to all the other places we tried in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Would suffice for 1 night if you've no other choice, but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: I3ishop
Reviews.Content: First off the area this hotel is in is very rough. There's lots of homeless around, they don't seem to be any threat but they don't do the property values any good either. The hotel is run down, the receptionist sits behind a protective screen, the rooms are very basic, not dirty but very very worn. The beds are uncomfortable, there are no toiletries, the place is very loud, you hear every step, both on your floor and the floor above. This place reminds me of a minimum security prison without the food service. The only reason I stayed is for a concert in the Hollywood Bowl, this hotel is walking distance from the venue, and was the only nearby hotel with rooms still available, next time I'll stay somewhere nicer and get a cab to the Hollywood Bowl.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, average accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: welshandpoi
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here as we wanted to spend time in Hollywood and this motel was in an excellent position for all the main attractions. There is a parking garage you have to pay for which is reasonable enough but we found you have to be there quite early to get a space. The room we stayed in was a little shabby and in need of an update. Apparently the hotel is undergoing some renovations so this might change soon. The room was clean enough though and we had all the usual facilites including wifi. The motel is a couple of minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard and everything was within reasonable walking distance. Very reasonably priced and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Service”
Reviews.Author: Richard Z
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Motel 6 LA Hollywood for 5 nights. We were very impressed about their staff service and efficiency. All staff have been very helpful and friendly, especially Vivian and Manuel at Reception who provided good service and offer (i.e. original price rather than current price) for our extended stay and assisted us with booking day trips. When my father had a fever, staff gave us the tablets immediately. We were very grateful for that. We highly recommend others come and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bare basics”
Reviews.Author: warriorbard
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for with this hotel.It's very basic, almost spartan given the sparse amenities provided in the room. The location, however, is admittedly quite good. It's only a 5-10 minute walk to Hollywood Blvd where all the tourist attractions are housed. The Hollywood/Highland train station is also nearby as are various bus stops. As mentioned, the rooms are very basic. There's a bed, TV, drawers and a bathroom. We were given a room on the first floor and after looking out the window only to find the back alley staring back at us, it didn't feel so safe especially given the fact that our window wouldn't close all the way. The walls and doors are also paper thin; I could hear the cleaning lady rolling her cart down the hallway as though my door was open. People dropping or thumping on their floor above us could also be heard clearly. The beds were comfortable enough to sleep in though they were rather squeaky when one sat down on it. If you're sleeping alone, it's fine but when you're sharing a bed and you move, the squeaky sound does get rather tiring. There's no wi-fi in the room though there is a computer lounge with 3 computers that have internet access in the reception area. The hotel also has a coin operated laundromat and a common area with vending machines and a microwave. Overall, Motel 6 is a very basic hotel. I would only recommend it if you've a tight budget or you're not overly picky and a sound sleeper. The location to the various Hollywood attractions are a good incentive but the hotel's actual location did not feel quite so safe. The staff were also quite curt but perhaps it was because I was there when they were booked solid. Personally, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Walking distance to Kodak theatre.”
Reviews.Author: fad58
Reviews.Content: Stayed in july. We booked a room with 2 dbl bed for 4 psn. We arrived late at night n was given a room with 1 dbl bed. After insisting n complaining the night clerk reluctantly chkd again n found us a room with 2 dbl.bed. Room size cleanliness are ok acceptable for the price. Location is very good close toKodak theare bus n metro.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, parking available but load on weekends”
Reviews.Author: nitework
Reviews.Content: Decent rooms and fair prices. But if you don't want to party yourself on weekends, you'd better stay somewhere else. It's our favorite budget motel in Hollywood anyway and we've been three three times.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Convienent”
Reviews.Author: foggirl78
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the Southland in over 20 years, and my first trip to Hollywood. I couldn't have picked a better motel to stay at. It is close to at least 4 Metro bus lines, and it's walking distance to all Hollywood sights. The staff was helpful and facilities were clean. I had no complaints. I would totally stay here again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money / Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: VLF1601
Reviews.Content: Motel 6 Hollywood, what else? No seriously this hotel is great. I spent couple of nights there with 2 friends of mine: the hotel is in the place to be: nearby bars, clubs, and so close from the walk of fame! Moreover the hotel itself is nice: good sized rooms, pretty clean! Staff was very helpful and gave me some tips and advices about the area! Great great great, only good memories!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, no bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: msperop
Reviews.Content: This was a good, safe hotel if you are looking for a cheap hotel on a budget. I was a single woman with teenage son. The area inside was safe, and never had a problem with staff. Check in was easy and so was check out. Some staff behind window are nicer than others but overall I had no problems. The cleaning staff did a fantastic job cleaning our room and giving us clean towels. I am a stickler on the cleaning. There were a few spots on the carpet in the room and several out in the hallway. IF you can look past that, then this is a great place for a couple of nights. The area outside is not so great...if you have a choice- stay here a night or two and then move on to a different location in Los Angeles. If you are one that is looking for the most renovated and up to date then move on and don't stay here. If you are worried about the image and want more luxorious, then move on and stay at a different hotel. Also, the beds had the covers on them to protect against bed bugs. It's the first thing I always check for...and NO bed bugs or any bugs in our room. My trick is to turn the ac on and it will drown out the surrounding noise. It has normal street noise...remember it is right off of Hollywood so there's no way around it unless you move further away from Hollywood. Pluses: Free wifi in room, and inexpensive laundromat on premises. Fridge in room.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: TheUglyPhotographer
Reviews.Content: Found Racist graffiti in the room. Request to change room was ignored. Had to stay in room with swastikas and racism scratched into the wood. Broken door to outside fire escape was open all night and off camera. Bugs and ants in the room. Complained to GM he offered me a gift certificate for a free stay. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain”
Reviews.Author: t16mytm
Reviews.Content: I was there during the New Year Eve season and I can say the receptionist was very helpful. The hotels were packed to the brim and due to our credit card fault our rooms were cancelled but we were not told about it until we arrive. The receptionist knew that it was peak season and knew that it will be hard to get another room from another hotel at late at night. He ask whether we mind having a TV-less room and we told him we don't mind as long there is a bed and a shower in it. So he ask the cleaner to clean up one of the rooms and we stay in it. It was ok room with all the necessary amenity and a fridge to go with it therefore there is nothing to complain. In the morning there are coffee and there is wifi in the rooms. It was near to the walk of fame and the hollywood sign so it is quite a good place to stay. There is a laundry room too and there is curfew for the opening of the laundry room but the receptionist was kind to inform us that the timing has extended as they knew lots of ppl have to do their washing which i find it very considerating.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, ok room, poor wifi, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Noocyte
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and it was ok. Please note that there is limiteded parking! Come early.. Very happy with the service. Rooms were clean, good fridge, poor tv.. Very close to Hollywood blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and a neat and tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacPark82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed the hotel. For the price the rooms are very tidy and of a very good size. The beds are very good and the location of the hotel is unbeatable. Only a 5 minute walk to all the central the Hollywood locations and landmarks. The staff were fantastic and even called me 20 minutes after I checked in to see if my room was ok and everything was good which I though was amazing for a budget hotel. The only problems I had with the room was that the TV reception was not very good but it was nothing too major. Also the free wifi was not great at certain times and slowed to crawl speed. Other times it was fine. I would recomend this Hotel for anyone on a budget and wants to see Hollywood and its attractions. Even Universal studios is only 1 metro train stop away with the metro station being only 5 minutes walk from the hotel at Hollywood and Highland center. You can also get to Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and Downtown very easy using public transport from the hotel which was a major plus. I will stay here again on my nexy trip to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location,clean hotel. Not too expencive”
Reviews.Author: teetee4343
Reviews.Content: hotel was nice and clean. better than expected. you cannot beat the location. graumens theater, kodak theater,wax museaum,jimmy kimmel live,ripleys plus a lot more are all within a 6 minute walk from hotels door 6 minutes yes!!!. cannot beat location or the price for a motel 6. Its not ceasers palace in Vegas but I know this will be my same spot anytime I visit LA. If you have had a bad review, I cannot see why. truly, I think most bad reviews comes from being upset at the hotel for something so people find thing to report negative ( I realize I have done that on a south beach hotel in Miami) i personally didnt like the room set up but is was modern and new like the shower comes right down over your head and my hair gets wet, that bad review to me) I, So, give this location a try. very clean rooms and bathroom is a plus for me. nice clean lobby, flat screens in room and iron but No hair dryer. parking is $10 dollars a day and you pay daily by noon. They also have a small garage but have a valet( cool) that is free. So, I loved that. no deposit for the room ( can you believe that!!!!!!!!!!!!) but, if you smoke, and they will ask you, and then its a $250.00 hold on your card( heads up)!! but if not, you sign a small agreement that you will not smoke, that's all... I don't smoke so that was good for me. who has money to be held up on a card anyways. I have a tip also, hertz rental cars has special offers where if you live in Arizona and rent a car and drive it back to LA,Vegas and a few other states, the car is a wopping $5.00 per day. Thats what we did. 8 dys was a total of 116.00 and that stupid hold of 140.00 so be aware of that and ask first cuz they tell U ANYTHING over the phone and get there and it totally false... hope this review helps, I did this several times and pic will not upload so I hot it works this time. From Chicago trip date 4/25,26,27 2011

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value let down by a couple of easy fixes”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastFarang
Reviews.Content: good location. comfortable bed. bath retained water after using. Rooms a little tired but okay. Lift was very slow. A lick of bright paint and a kettle or jug in each room would turn the ordinary room into an enjoyable room. The only drink available was bitter re-brewed coffee available in the public foyer from 8am to 10 am. Free internet in room did not work. The foyer internet worked sometimes. The male staff had all the charm and personality of a striking cobra. The domestic staff were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good and central but ... difficult to park around”
Reviews.Author: italian4USA
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean Motel 6 in Los Angeles-Hollywood. Perfect if you don't have a car. Otherwise there is some difficulty to find place since their parking is very small.. we had to go to a public parking (10$ flat fare one day).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location steps away from Hollywood blv.”
Reviews.Author: Christin105
Reviews.Content: Room is comfy and clean! Location is excellent! They have washer and dryer! Didn't like the loud young people banging doors and being disrespectfully loud! You have to call the front desk and they take care of it! Bring a hairdryer with you ! or borrow it at the front desk . Foyer smells like urine but the room is ok and clean. Great location and cheap!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineMcB
Reviews.Content: Me and my roommate stayed it this hotel from March 14-16th, 2011 and I was pleasantly surprised by it. I read up on all the hotels in Hollywood to find a cheap place to stay at and found this one. After reading the reviews I was kind of wary about but we went with it anyways and I'm glad we did. We had purchased the Hollywood City Pass and all the locations are less than 10 minute walking distance away which really helped on gas and parking. It was quiet at night but that could depend on the floor you stay on. (We were on the third floor) They offer free Wi-Fi and they have room service that is expensive since you have to order $15 or more and there is a $3 fee but the food was good. The only thing I would say that I didn't like is that you have to pay $10 for parking and there is not a lot of space so once it is full you are out of luck. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others that are going to stay in Hollywood..

Reviews.Title: “Get a second opinion”
Reviews.Author: VeroniquePalmer
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for - this place is one of the cheaper ones down Hollywood Boulevard, so if you're on a budget ok. If you can afford anything better, do so. The bed is nice and big, but the blankets are thin and I was cold every night. The pillows are too hard. There is no cupboard for clothes, nor anyway to lock valuables away. (Not that I had anything go missing though). The paint is badly chipped on the main table in the room and much too close to the bed, so you can't get in and out of the chair if you need to use a laptop there for example. I just took the chair away and sat on the bed eventually. The front desk staff are not that efficient at all, and certainly don't go out of the way to help with anything. It feels like they are doing you a favour more than anything. Whatever you do, don't book any tours with the front desk! They are clearly getting commission from Starline tours so push their services hard, but Starline leave a lot to be desired! Look on the internet for tours, or get a pamphlet from the reception area and call yourself. The motel will make you pay a deposit too - it takes away your options to change your mind about something. They don't change currency, so make sure you have enough. The motel tends to be noisy so ask for a room at the end of the passage where there's less traffic. There is some kind of casual bar type thing at the back of the motel, which gets very noisy to very late at night. You'll need a sleeping pill to sleep through it. The location is kind of in the middle of Hollywood Boulevard, around 4 long blocks in either direction to any of the action. While I walked back alone around midnight with no issue, some of the places you pass are really seedy and I did feel a little uncomfortable. A cab ride is just over $5 to the Hard Rock Cafe. There is a small market shop on the corner for water and snacks, but it's really grungy and dodgy. Would I stay here again? No, but then again, I have no plans to return to Los Angeles thankfully.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: pet267
Reviews.Content: This Motel 6 is more hotel style, it was the priciest Motel 6 we have stayed in, but its location just behind the Hollywood Boulevard is brilliant (always ask for a discount, especially if you're staying for a few nights). You have to pay for the parking but it has 24 hour security. The rooms were huge and clean with a fridge and large bathroom. The staff were helpful. The only negatives about this motel were noisy neighbours being unable to park in the car park two nights in a row as it was full.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: mcco_99
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed in our stay at motel 6 Hollywood. Staff were not friendly or helpful. While the location was good - only a short walk to Hollywood Blvd, there were alot of homeless people and shady looking people around the front which did not make us feel safe to walk around at night. This hotel is best suited for younger people and backpackers as the whole feel of the hotel was Glorified Backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Costly but is in Center of Hollywood. Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: ABCDEFG_1234
Reviews.Content: Motel 6 its pricey but you are in the centre of Hollywood. Good things : Spacious room good cleaning- friendly Mexican cleaners always smiling despite little English language elevator was fast/clean don’t have to wait around much location good, although it is nearer the rougher side of Hollywood boulevard. newspapers in the lobby daily TV in the lobby 24 hours security and cameras Fransisco and the weekday night shift gentleman was friendly and very helpful, he promptly replaced our fridge when it was not working. Clean towels/linen Bad things: rooms need refurbishment. Broken sink/tiles despite high price $80/night TV old Windows don’t open much (only 3cm) rooms get stuffy bathroom extractor fan not very strong either room keys don’t always work, trial and error Very noisy on weekends - dunk students running up and down corridors at 3am Tea/coffee is disgusting. no fresh milk there is no ramp outside the motel so its hard to carry up luggage. pets are allowed, slightly unsure if thy have access to all rooms or just a specific level. would not be nice to know there was a dog sleeping previously in our bed. I would recommend it for a short stay just to see the attractions if you can tolerate its bad points. For the cost I'm not sure you're exactly getting what you paid for but at least it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Discusting”
Reviews.Author: Cuellar96
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Motel 6 motels before and I am usually satisfied, but this motel was horrible. There were so many problems: 1.The neighborhood is not good 2. The parking garage is underground but there only one way in and out, and barely enough room to turn around. My family and I had to park at a parking garage near by. 3. The shower was bad in general and it takes extremely long to drain. 4. Hard beds and noisy environment. 5. The entire motel was not clean(room, elevator,etc.) Whenever I go back to Hollywood, I will most definitely NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DaniDionello
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, walking distance of walk of fame. Room and bath were nice, clean. The front desk is not so friendly, but i didn´t have any problem. Free wifi, refrigerator inside the room, ice machine and laundry in the first floor. Parking is U$10,00 a day, and you have to pay every morning for each day.

Reviews.Title: “Loud”
Reviews.Author: mikeinlamesa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Motel 6 in Hollywood as a last minute change in my plans. I booked the room by walking in but probably could have gotten a better price by booking in advance. The room was adequate but being a Friday night there was a lot of noisy foot traffic both inside and outside the hotel after the clubs let out.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Motel 6 Was A GREAT deal for my money”
Reviews.Author: JennyJazz
Reviews.Content: For my moms birthday I flew her out to Los Angeles to meet me as I was in town doing some work. I thought that staying at the Hollywood Motel 6 would be perfect for our "Hollywood trip" and it was. The location couldnt have been better! It was right off of Hollywood Blvd and was within walking distance of some major tourist attractions that we planned on doing. My mom especially enjoyed the early mornings sitting outside as the people who lived in the apartments and houses nearby walked their dogs and jogged. It didnt feel like you were at a motel, but in a safe and familiar neighborhood, I guess because thats what it was. The only problem we had was that our first room's AC didnt cool, but we called downstairs and was quickly relocated to a 2nd room that cooled just fine. It even had a larger tv : ) I dont want to downplay the great time we had because the AC going out is very understandable and was remedied immediately. Over all it was a no frills but charming place that we were glad to rest our heads at every night. Great deal for a tight budget!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep next to the Stars!”
Reviews.Author: Sallysguys
Reviews.Content: Location was the best and the staff as well as the the other guests were great people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Giovanni_Benassi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, with large room, clean bathroom and full of amenities (but without hair dryer, like all Motel 6). The location is great, just 100 m from Hollywood Boulevard and three blocks from the Hollywood Sign point of view, and easy to get to with the metro red line (stop Hollywood/Highland).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Davone70
Reviews.Content: Good value with all the basic needed for sightseeing visit. Close to all public transports, all within 5 minuts walk to buses and train stations and free internet is a plus. You can buy $5 a ticket from the trainstation will get you all day travel on any buses or trains anywhere in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: Arrived from a 14hr flight to find a clean and comfortable chain motel. Checked in promptly and headed straight for the shower which was more than adequate and clean. The room was a little dated but was fine for 2 single blokes with plenty of room and a fridge. TV was old but we weren't here to watch tv so wasn't an issue for us. There were enough power points for both of us to charge our phones, cameras etc without unplugging any room amenities. The biggest selling point for this motel is the location! It is on a sidestreet just off Hollywood Blvd and about 3 blocks from the central Hollywood & Highland Centre where the Kodak Theatre, Chinese Theatre and subway is located. A few blocks down the other way of Hollywood Blvd is the Hollywood & Vine area with Pantages Theatres. If you are here to go clubbing then this motel is also ideal as its very close to the main clubbing scene on Hollywood Blvd and off on Cahuenga. Only complaint was that the wi-fi wasn't working on our floor during our 4 night stay so we had to take our laptop down to the lobby (no real big drama). And also you have to pay $10 a day for parking which is limited anyway. If you plan to arrive back to the motel late (after 10pm) and leave before 8am, then you can just park out the front on the street for free. However, you must move the car in the morning or put money in the meter as the parking enforcement officers are very diligent!

Reviews.Title: “cheap & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: oriel_svk
Reviews.Content: a good stay for anyone, who needs a bed + shower for a night. free wi-fi (which is extremly slow and buggy). a low chance to find a parking at this hotel (you can leave your car in a private parking garage in a parallel street). noisy cleaning staff (be prepared to wake up every morning to some loud mexican song coming from the hall way, when the cleaning staff come to work (6-7am?)). anyway, you ll got an excelent location, right next to the boulevard for an affordable price. but would i recommend it to a friend? no...

Reviews.Title: “An adequate crash-pad”
Reviews.Author: dantheman_nz
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel, so don't set your expectations too high. Location-wise it's brilliant as four (or five) blocks away is the Kodak Theater, and all the Hollywood stuff that tourists come for. This means that you'd only need to walk for 10 minutes and be in the middle of everything without worrying about parking, subway etc. In saying that, you'd also get the occasional interaction with the homeless community of Hollywood, being in that close to a tourist attraction. While they are mostly harmless, they do smell as well.... If you'd like to be able to park in the underground garage, pay your $10 quickly as it gets filled up pretty quickly. When we were there it was about at 150% off capacity but there have a parking attendant who parks your car etc. As with most budget properties, things do look and feel old, threadbare carpets, and no coffee or tea making facilities. There is only one elevator so when things get busy you'd have to wait patiently for it to arrive. Ice machine is on the ground floor, and they provide tea/coffee between 8-10am. It was quite hard getting good internet connection at level 5, we had to log in to the level 4 wi-fi connection but it wasn't a very strong connection. This is free BTW.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: townB
Reviews.Content: Located only about 50 metres from Hollywood Boulevard, this hotel combines good value with decent amenities. It is situated about 5-10 minutes walk from Hollywood & Highland Shopping Complex, El Capitan Theatre, Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre and many other attractions along Hollywood Boulevard. There are many tour opperators along this stretch as well, which can provide you the opportunity to get out and see more of Los Angeles. The hotel staff are not exactly the happiest of people but are efficient. The rooms are clean enough, really big and spacious with a large bed. They have an empty bar fridge and good size TV (not flat screen though). Would recommed this hotel to pretty much everyone. The price is good, so is the location, and it provides a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe, clean, big room, good value, nice helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hdoggydogg
Reviews.Content: What more can you ask for? Its perhaps 50 metres away from Hollywood Boulevard!!! Big clean room, good value, helpful staff, safe neighbourhood, quiet, I could talk about this motel in a positive way 4-ever. I highly recommend this place!! I think it would be a good place for families aswell!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, not such a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: ichliebewien
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews, i was not expecting much from this hotel, except the bare bones. What most reviewers wrote was spot on: The location is great!! Advice: When you walk to Hollywood Blvd. turn to your right and keep walking, If you turn to the left, it is just endless stripper shop, tattoo parlors, etc. Perhaps colorful if you've never seen this kind of thing before, but not at all if you're from any big city in Europe or USA. The rooms were relatively clean, but REALLY spartan. However, they DO provide a mini-fridge, which is a big plus to keep cold drinks in, or milk for the kids' breakfast cereal (no gratis breakfast as in Best Western, etc.). Beds were comfortable, no excessive noise. The place is filled with European youth groups on holiday, so check in can be really slow if you hit it at the same time as one of these groups. With parking ($10/night) this Motel 6 turns out to be about $100/night on Hotels.com, which I feel is a bit pricey for what you get. That was the only drawback for me.

Reviews.Title: “I'm through with Motel 6.”
Reviews.Author: Colleen010
Reviews.Content: Motel 6 in Hollywood is very short on parking. When we arrived, I was told we needed to pay for parking on the premises. I asked to pay for both days, but the clerk, David P., said I had to pay day by day. When I tried paying the next night, after a long day of sightseeing, I was told there was no more space. The same clerk, David P., told me that the parking is full by 3pm, and I should have paid earlier. When I tried to protest that he had ample time to tell me that the day before, he just cut me off and said, "there's nothing I can do about it." I got the impression it's an on-going line they're told to say even though he could have given me a heads-up the day before. Doing the math, though, the motel was five stories high with only 46 parking places. I don't think they wanted me (or anyone else) to know that until I was already stuck there. We ended up having to drag our luggage two blocks the morning of our departure to a private parking garage where we were forced to park the night before.

Reviews.Title: “If You Only Want Location”
Reviews.Author: Corey87
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel wasn't that bad for me but I can definitely believe the reviews that think it was. I was extremely unhappy to arrive at 1:30 p.m. and find that I had no parking as the lot was full. They advertise as having parking. To me, that means that you have a spot for EVERY room in your hotel. I was instructed to park in a garage a block away. This was very scary as Hollywood Boulevard was a very seedy area with many scary people lurking about. What made it worse was that we had to leave at 4 a.m. to drive back to San Diego to fly home which meant that I had to walk in the pitch black to go get the car. I was scared to death as I walked by people sitting outside at that time at the seedy hotel next door and homeless people on the street. I feel very lucky to be alive and with all of my money. As far as the room, it wasn't the cleanest but passable. the most basic room I have ever seen, though. Not one thing hung on the walls and like others have said, NO CLOCK. This made me very uncomfortable to rely on a wake up call for our 4 a.m. wake up. We set our cell phones but had never done that before so I was scared to rely on that also. We should have been alarmed that the check in desk is behind what looks like bullet proof glass. I so wish we had stayed in a nicer area and just driven to Hollywood Boulevard to see the sites since I had to pay for a parking garage anyways.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: borderline
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel but at least is clean. good points: location, just a few blocks away from the Chinese theatre, area seems safe at least during the day, small grocery store around the corner. Free wi-fi (only good in the lobby). Clean Rooms. Bad points: strong smell in the room, lack of ventilation, window wouldn't opened. Wi-fi in the room was terrible, had to go to the lobby to get a connection.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: celinetmika
Reviews.Content: I chose this motel after I read the reviews here. What I needed was a clean room close to Hollywood bvd and not too expensive. Well that's what I got! The motel is in a street next to Hollywood Bvd, about 4 or 5 blocks from the Chinese Theater. It looks pretty safe and as a woman traveling alone, I wasn't afraid or anything. (Although I did not get out alone at night) The room was very clean, the bathroom too. The furniture and all of course are very basic, it is a Motel 6, but I still slept well and had no major problems. All in all it was okay, as long as you know what to expect you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Bones Budget Option in a Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Cecil55
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here at least a dozen times over the past ten years, and the following comments would hold true for every one of my stays: If you're looking for a cheap place to crash in the heart of Hollywood with clean beds and bathrooms and absolutely nothing else (and I really mean nothing else), this is your best bet. The place is spartan and slightly shabby at best. The free wi-fi is perhaps the only perk. The front desk folks are usually worthless in terms of advice or suggestions and the rooms sometimes smell a bit funky. The motel's limited parking slots are assigned daily on a first-come basis and go quickly, so if you happen to arrive in the evening, you'll be forced to park your car at a lot located a block away. So why stay here? Location, location, location (and price). You're walking distance from all of the major Hollywood attractions, as well as decent bars and restaurants, not to mention subway stations and bus routes. And you're within easy driving distance of the major movie studios and some great neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Staff and horrible staying experience”
Reviews.Author: ifatts
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in Motel 6 for 2 nights during March. The room was a bit dirty and not attractive what so ever with view of brick wall but the reason this staying experience was so horrible for me was the staff. When I left motel 6 on Hollywood I forgot a bag with jewelry and makeup in the bathroom. I found out about that after I left LA. I contacted the hotel and asked them to send me the bag to my home address and I will pay for the delivery but they rudely declined. I tried to talk to them for a whole week and even talked but they just told me to turn to FedEx and do all the necessary arrangements by myself. So I did. The FedEx delivery guy had to come to the hotel twice and the staff only gave him the bag at the second time. With absolutely no help from the hotel staff I got the bag in my home address just to find out that all the jewelry was gone!!! (And only the make up was left in the bag). This jewelry had sentimental value in addition to its price. I am very angry about the way they are treating their guests and I can say that I will never stay at hotel 6 ever again, and also recommend others not to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great low budget option”
Reviews.Author: Elaphros
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what to think of some of the folks that reviewed this place, but it was fine for my needs. I booked this place for two nights in late March, I was going to a concert at the Hollywood Bowl and the proximity of this place was excellent for that. I'm a single female, so after looking at a lot of reviews I was glad that a friend of mine decided to stay here too. His room was on a different floor than mine, but he was fine with his accommodations too. I'd say first and foremost, if you're expecting this to be more than a budget motel then you probably need to adjust your expectations and/or consider paying top dollar for a room at a 3 or 4 star hotel. It's located in a residential neighborhood just off of Hollywood Blvd, yes there's no breakfast buffet, but there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance. Mel's Drive-In is on Highland and Hollywood and they've got a $3.99 breakfast that runs from 6am-10am. I didn't bother to try the coffee downstairs because they don't have creamer, and I like creamer. I didn't bother to use the vending machines downstairs because there's a little 24/7 market on the corner of Whitley and Hollywood and there's a refrigerator in the room. In the lobby there's a tv running, news was on it whenever I walked by. There's a computer lab with 3 PCs within it, and there is wireless access in the rooms but you'll need to ask the front desk for the WEP key to get online. I did, and the signal on the 3rd floor was great (looks like they've got access points on each floor). The tv worked, but the remote was buggy. The beds were clean, I'd reserved a room with double queens because I kind of wanted the option of using extra pillows and blankets, no bedbugs or varmints in the sheets. The bathroom was clean, I knew that they didn't stock shampoo's or conditioner so make sure you keep that in mind (but who in the world travels without their own shampoo and conditioner??!). There were people partying in a room down the hall, close to the elevator area, but once I walked a few doors down from theirs I didn't hear them at all. Yes the elevator is slow, so I only used it to get my stuff up to my room and back down ... and when I felt lazy (I was walking around a lot before and after I checked in), it was always faster to walk down the stairs so I always used the stairs to come down. I didn't park in the garage under the building, it was full and there's only a few spaces down there. I parked around the block on Cheyenne in a really nice multilevel parking structure for the same price that I would have parked downstairs for (i.e. $10/day). Parked it on a Monday night and didn't bother to pick it back up until Wednesday, that garage doesn't accept credit cards or debit cards, it's a "cash only" situation so be warned to have cash onhand when you're picking up your vehicle. The proximity to Hollywood Blvd is fantastic, hopped on a tourbus at the corner of Whitley and Hollywood and spent a couple of hours being entertained by the driver (she was a hoot). Ultimately this was a really good bargain for my needs, I knew I wasn't going to be in the room very much and really just needed a shower, a bed and a place to store my stuff. Was able to book it for $55/night through Orbitz and if that's not a great deal then I don't know what is. If I had to pay more than that then I'm not sure if I would have gone for it (had a reservation for the Comfort Inn on Highland that was $35 more per night and I canceled it to give this place a go, and I do not regret having done that. Use google maps to get a street view of the location if you're still on the fence.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but a great location”
Reviews.Author: lmdja
Reviews.Content: Room was basic, no extras (shampoo, hairdryer, coffee, etc.) but it was clean, the staff was helpful, and we had no complaints. The location is perfect, close enough to walk to the attractions in Hollywood but far enough off Hollywood Blvd to be away from street noise. We were wakened one night by a loud party in one of the rooms but it was soon stopped by the alert staff.

Reviews.Title: “terrible wheelchair access, but otherwise adequate”
Reviews.Author: ColoWheeler
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertised wheelchair accessible rooms with roll in showers. The hotel had given our accessible rooms away to non-disabled travelers, and all our arguing for the access ended up being worthless because the rooms were so inaccessible. The hotel was extremely busy, loud, but otherwise had typical motel 6 amenities. Be prepared for long waits for the elevator while the housekeeping staff monopolize the elevator for 30+ minutes at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable Cheap Crashpad”
Reviews.Author: bectoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last September for 2 nights and found it perfect for our needs. It was clean, cheap and central. Would definitely stay here again if I was in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm”
Reviews.Author: luvsthetravel
Reviews.Content: I really did not like this hotel very much, there were hookers you could hear doing the dirty all night, the toilet over flowed twice and i felt pretty unsafe. Really what can you expect with prices like this, i mean if you want nicer accommodation then pay a little bit more. This hotel would be great for backpackers and people on a budget cause it is close to central Hollywood. At the end of the day you get what you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bited 8 times by unknown bugs hidden in Motel 6! Itching harmed travel feeling!!”
Reviews.Author: angeliayy
Reviews.Content: Motel 6 is the first but worst hotel in my california tour. No hairdryer in bathroom, no breakfast (only coffee), internet need $2.99/day, above all are normally free in other motel. And after 2 nights stayed in the Motel 6 Los Anlgeles-Hollywood, my left arm were bited 8 times by unknown bugs hidden in Motel 6! It's very hot, red ,and itching, which harmed my traveling feeling! After leaving motel 6, my arm recovered little by little. This is the first time I was bited at a motle in my traveling experience, I will never chose Motel 6 in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Project86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very adequate. You have to go to this hotel with the thought in mind that you will only be staying there to sleep and it's not glamorous by any means. It was definitely sufficient for a basic person's needs. The cons were there was one person at the front desk (young guy, don't know his name) when we checked in that was a bit surly and never smiled or was polite. The room itself was in decent condition but felt cheap (which I guess is okay, since it's cheap anyway!). Also, a little thing, no guide of channels or anything for the tv, so that was a bit annoying, since we didn't know where anything was. The pros: by far, the saving grace of this hotel is its location. Literally 1 minute from the hollywood walk of fame, 5-7 minutes from hollywood and highland and grauman's is only a few minutes farther than that. It does have the internet, which is very helpful...but it took a while to connect (guy at the desk did not give any instructions on how to connect, despite me calling down twice to find out how). But despite everything, we were able to sleep tehre without a problem and the value for the location/quality is good. p.s. I gave this four stars because i wanted to give it 3.5...but since you can't, i'll round up, since i think it's definitely better than a 3 out of five

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff and very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: serge_vc
Reviews.Content: - The location close to Hollywood Blv is great, but that's about the only advantage I can think of. - The rooms were clean when we arrived. - The staff is not very friendly and they act as if they don't care. - During our stay there was also lots of noise in the hallways and in the rooms above us. People were apparently walking around constantly or it looked like they were 'moving furniture'. - The walls and floors are also very thin. - The bed was too short for my body size (I'm 1m80). - The garage is very small and they park cars in front of another if they lack free parking lots. - You have to renew your parking lot every day before noon. Price 10 US$ per day. - High Speed Internet is actually Slow Speed Internet... but it works.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very cheap”
Reviews.Author: chazza747
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant in booking this motel given some reviews and the "motel" title, but was pleasantly suprised. If you need to travel to all the sights around LA via bus or train and want to be close to shops etc, then this motel is in a fantastic location. It's very basic (only soap and towels in rooms, no hairdryer, no microwave etc), but the rooms are fairly quiet, clean and front desk staff are okay (not great, they are young!). The neighbourbood seems fairly safe and we had no problems walking around at night. If you are only going to your hotel room to sleep, then for the price, this is highly recommended. Save your money for the fantastic shopping nearby (a few blocks walk)! .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no frills but perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: pyjama-addict
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveller overseas (and a nervous one at that), I booked my first night in the US at a motel rather than my planned hostels to sleep off the jet lag The Motel 6 is on a rather non-descript side street off Hollywood Boulevard and is very basic, although my room itself was actually nicer than the foyer would have led me to believe. The staff on the front desk were polite, if not particularly friendly, and there was a room off to one side with free internet which was continually popular with others staying in the motel My room was fine, with a spotless bathroom and a big comfy bed. The TV had fewer channels than many other US hotels I stayed in but still many more than most Australian ones do and the area was comparatively quiet But the real star is the location: from the front door of the motel, it's maybe fifteen metres off to the left before you hit Hollywood Boulevard and the Walk of Fame, with a slightly seedier section if you turn left onto the Boulevard and the more famous attractions like Grauman's Chinese Theater off to the right At $99 a night, the Motel 6 is a really good option for a budget traveller

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it...”
Reviews.Author: Gonzo_in_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for over a month. We were remodeling a local auto parts store. I've stayed in alot of Motel 6 class motels to me this one was no different except for parking. Most of the time we parked in the parking structure on No. Cherokee which the motel reimbused us for everytime. Lots of things to see and do within walking distance. Saw lots of Stars, homeless, drunks, and L. Ron Hubbard's followers down on Hollywood Blvd. But hey, That's Hollywood. All in all I would stay here on my own accord, even if my company wasn't picking up the tab.

Reviews.Title: “If all you need is a clean room with bed and bathroom, go for it!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchieSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed over there for 5 consecutive nights. At $80 a night + tax it's a pretty good value for Hollywood. Now, you get what you pay for, so if you're after service and expect to spend a lot of time in your room, forget it. It's all very basic: Tea/coffee facility in lobby until 11am or so, laundry, ice and vending machines 24/7, free internet access in the lobby (3 PCs) from 10am til 9pm. In the room, 2 single or 1 queen bed, 2 bedside tables, a desk and a TV make the only furniture. Iron + board provided. Bathroom was clean as well as linen. Soundproofing was not perfect but good enough to respect your "privacy" :D Over all, a clean place, good value if you spend your time outdoors and fantastic location...

Reviews.Title: “great location but basic service”
Reviews.Author: eddieecat
Reviews.Content: A basic hotel but a stones throw away from all of the hustle and bustle of LA. The thing that let it down was the cleaners. They are very noisy and if you are jet laged then the last thing you need are cleaners screaming at one another in Spanish. Good hotel if you are on a budget. We are going back to LA this year and have avoided this hotel. The parking in this area is also a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Basic Clean Hotel Great if you want to be right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: gemma1GoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Motel 6 for 4 nights, great location exit the hotel and turn left you are on hollywood boulevard. right on the walk of fame. this is a basic hotel reminds me of a backpackers where you are given your own room. you can do laundry here though and it is free intenet access. Safe Hotel in a safe area

Reviews.Title: “Wicked location makes up for average room”
Reviews.Author: Taylynn
Reviews.Content: We came down for a show and this was the cheapest place we could find that had a decent reputation. Now, any Motel 6 I've ever been in has been the BARE minimum and this was no exception. The towels were scratchy, there were no complimentary toiletries, the view sucked, but you know what? We walked left from the front door, down a block, and we were on the Walk Of Fame. Head right on Hollywood Blvd. and you are right down the street from the Kodak Theatre. The only time we spent in the room was to sleep so who CARES if its super fantastic? You are in Hollywood! The sheets and towels are clean, its decently quiet, and the staff was really nice. All in all, it was a great cheap place to stay. If we go there again, thats where we'll get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: ecnart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Motel 6 Hollywood for 7 nights, visiting from Toronto for the first time. I got a discount rate while booking my flight on Expedia The frontdesk staff was quite helpful whenever I had questions. On arrival they gave me a list of directions to attractions & stores/food (e.g. Target, Denny's) near the hotel. There is a microwave in the lobby & coffee & tea are provided until 11AM The room, washroom & carpets were clean - no bugs or smells! The sheets & towels were clean. Good selection of TV & cable channels. Wifi is free! and it worked fine for me - I was on the 2nd floor. I did see people sitting in the lobby with their laptops, maybe the signal isn't strong enough in all rooms Location is amazing!, it is steps away from Hollywood Blvd. There is a Metro bus stop, convenience stores, pharmacies, currency exchange and it is about 5-8 min walk to Hollywood & Highland (many Hollywood attractions & stores and Red line subway station - 1 stop before Universal City) Would recommended this motel to anyone who is looking for an affordable, good & conveniently located place to stay when visiting Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Location is awesome but thats it...”
Reviews.Author: Hydronly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights since we already booked it we stayed 6 nights, otherwise we would have left after the first .. The front desk was far from professional, all our questions were answered with 'uhuh'. The beds were hard as a rock and on the first night there was a huge cockroach crawling on the wall. The rooms were clean tho, and if we would find one more roach we would have left no mather if we payed for the next couple of nights. We didn't, so we stayed here all the 6 nights in Hollywood. The locaiton is perfect, its 1 minute walk from Hollywood Blvd. (Walk of Fame). It's close to the METRO (underground) and from there it was very easy and super cheap to get to down town Los Angeles and Universal City. Next time we'll pay a little more and will go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I had no problems here”
Reviews.Author: akr1214
Reviews.Content: I visited hollywood for a week in june and stayed at the motel 6 on whitley. i went with my sister, we are 29 and 23 both females, and we have hever been to hollywood, it was my first time even flying. at first we were unsure if we picked a good place, since we didnt know the area we were going to be staying at...but when we finally arrived it is pretty safe feeling. we had no problems at the motel or walking the streets sightseeing. the parking attendants and front desk people were nice to us and were helpful. the rooms were not too bad, its not like we were in them 24/7, they did just fine. overall, i think it was a good choice for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “BE AFRAID, BE VERY AFRAID!!!”
Reviews.Author: ManoloFan
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all these other people who have rated this Hotel decent were seeing that I didn't see, but they are totally wrong! This hotel was NASTY! The only good thing about it, is it's location....close to a lot of things visitors want to see in L.A., but the hotel itself wasn't worth $20! Immediately waking into the lobby you think, well, it's not so bad for a Motel 6, and then you get into the elevator...IF it ever comes for you! We thought that at any second it was going to crash and burn while we were in it! As soon as we got off onto our floor the smell of disenfectant permeated the halls! If you need to use THAT much disenfectant to clean the rooms, then you should know that the rooms must be awful. I don't want to have to smell any sort of cleaning products when staying at a hotel. Granted, this was Motel 6, and I wasn't expecting much, but I WAS expecting decency! The bed covers looked unclean and the sheets, while I even bent down and smelled them to make sure they smelled like they were clean, barely passed muster! What happened to even CHEAP bottles of shampoo and conditioner, lotion? I forgot my shampoo and thought, DANG, so much for thinking this place would have any. The room smelled awful. Musty and like mildew! A hotel room without a clock/radio? I would have settled just for a clock because I surely wouldn't have trusted any wake-up call from this place! Not even a cheap, folding luggage rack. Who wants to look at their clothes hanging up in the room? No real closets in this place! And do you think you guys can invest in a decent bar of soap? I didn't even think those teeny-tiny bars of soap were still made! Towels were paper thin, not even a cheap box of Kleenex in the bathroom and the tub was horribly nasty...so much so that me and my two grown kids wore my flip-flops when taking a shower....and only to NOT have ANY hot water in the entire hotel the next morning! How does a major hotel not have hot water? We all had to take cold showers in order to get dressed to check out. Thank GOD we only needed the one night's stay. And thank GOD I had the forethought to bring a can of Lysol with me. I sprayed that entire room and bathroom! Toilet included!! I agree with everyone here who wasn't satisfied...paper thin walls, noisy, needed an ironing board and iron and WE had to go and get it from the front desk! Nothing like a huge ironing board being handed to you over the [---] check-in counter! No drawers to place your clothes, not even a complimentary pen with a pad of paper sitting beside that filthy telephone (which I also sprayed down with Lysol!) Stay away from this place if you can afford anything above it's going room rate! The comfort level is zero! The cleanliness level, is minus 100!! When we left all I could say is that the place must cater to hookers and crackheads because they're the only folks that wouldn't care about any of this stuff . They should just bulldoze the place and re-build!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfgs7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Las Vegas and LA trip. Along the way we stayed at the Motel 6 on Whitley. Arrived around 3pm on a Friday and had no wait for check in. Parking (mentioned already) is $10, which is fair for the area. We pulled in the garage and it is tiny. There is a attendent there to help with bags or park if you are not comfortable doing so. It is tight parking!!! Also if you do get in the lot don't leave! We were in the room no longer than an hour and the lot was full by then. People had to park a couple of blocks away. The room was typical budget motel. We had a king bed, non smoking. There were no strange smells when we walked in. There were quite a few large stains on the floor in the hall as well as some smaller ones in the room. Shoes were wore all the time. Bed was comfy and clean. Bathroom was clean, lots of counter space for junk. Shower was excellent, lots of pressure. All in all the hotel was good. Location made the price a little higher than it would be out of town.

Reviews.Title: “motel 6 is sweet awesomness!!”
Reviews.Author: mfon85
Reviews.Content: the motel 6 hollywood could not have been better for the location and price. our room was cleaned everyday. the front desk was super helpful. we walked everywhere: la cantina was around the corner, hollywood and highland was a short walk, all the clubs and bars are walkable: the kress was at the end of the street, ritual, sugar, les deux, geisha house, crimson everything was right there. theres also a fridge in the room. it was quiet during our stay. loved it made an amazing choice despite shifty reviews. couldnt have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but very ok!”
Reviews.Author: Athens85
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in June 2008. The hotel is very simple, but it is clean and has a excellent location in Hollywood. We paid USD 80 for one night that was the right price. Rooms are simple but clean. If you look for something cheap in Hollywood go to Motel 6!The comparasion between what you pay and what you get is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money & Great Location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: KL_Sue
Reviews.Content: Given prices of hotels in the "revitalised" Hollywood the US$ 80 per room we paid for the Motel 6 just of Hollywood Blvd during our 4 night stay was brilliant. Parking is an extra $10 (and fills up quickly) but it is still a bargain; Motel6 is only 1 min from the Walk of Fame and 5 mins from Grumman's Chinese Theatre. Would also recommend the Roosevelt Hotel for a cool poolside bar close by (7 min walk). Back to the motel - rooms are what you would expect from the chain- functional, clean, free Wi-Fi and OK for size but nothing special. Similarly staff are polite and competent but not 5 star. The Hollywood Blvd area remains a little scruffy (but much improved) and the hotel appears safe as it is 100metres of the Blvd down Whitley Ave. In short, exactly what you would expect from one of Accor's basic chains but great value for the area and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: 559MoM
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I had a higher expectation for this stay. My sister had surgery in Beverly Hills and we needed a clean, not so expensive place to stay one night. Not so expensive is what we got. Clean? The room had trash in it and a musty feel and smell that was only relieved by running the air conditioner (which works great by the way!). The staff was cordial but very lazy and unorganised. @ check in the clerk insisted she see my sister and her i.d. so she can stay in the room, which was fine but she left her standing there while she had a personal conversation on the phone, not something one wants to do post-op. A large dog made a mess in the door way and it stayed there for well over 2 hours. We asked for a couple extra pillows around 7 p.m. and it was'nt untill almost 11 p.m. we were woke up by the front desk calling our phone to tell us to come pick them up. The upside of the stay; it was cheap, quiet, not far from some interesting sights and apperantly pets are welcome. Oh! Parking is $10 to stay in their lot.

Reviews.Title: “I had no complaints”
Reviews.Author: armygirl2019
Reviews.Content: My friend reserved the room for us and I was a bit hesistant. From the outside it is an old building, but the inside is much nicer. We stayed for 3days and it was well worth the price. You are right there on Hollywood Blvd. Room was clean and not noisy at all. Parking wasnt an issue either. I'd recommend if you want to vaca on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic place to stay near Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Sofi_G
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here in 2 rooms for 6 nights in May 2008, the rooms are basic but clean, for the price u cant beat it! Had absolutley no problems! If you plan to book, make sure u reserve online first as you get cheaper rates than at the hotel. This hotel is a great location, literally a 5-10 min walk to Chinese Theatre/kodak theatre, etc. This is also a great place to stay if you are relying on public transport,we were close to metro to get to Universal and with tips off trip advisor easily got the bus to Santa Monica Beach and Warner Bros. They dont have safes at hotel, u can borrow hairdryers and irons - they just hold onto your ID. The neigbourhood was fine. The check in desk are helpful and can give directions, etc. if you get the chance go to a dodgers game - absolutely brilliant, great atmosphere, everyone was friendly and get u involved with the cheering and chanting, etc. Also try and get hold of tickets to jimmy kimmel, they're free and have some great guests and its opposite chinese theatre so close to hotel. We got to see P diddy on the show we saw. Also the taping isnt as long as some tv shows, it must have been 2 - 2.5 hours which flew by! ] Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay forget other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Nicolpau
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great surprise. It is different than the others Motel 6. It is a building. Good location, close to Kodak Theather. All corridors are clean. The lobby is cozy. The room was clean. We were travelling in 8 persons using two rooms. No problem. Good parking. Good location. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: cali1296
Reviews.Content: First of all, you have to understand that this location cannot be beat. It's on Whitley, which is less than a half-block from Hollywood Boulevard. This is a famous street -- the Hollywood Walk of Fame is here, in addition to Kodak Theater and Mann's Chinese Theater. There is a lot of foot traffic on Hollywood Boulevard, locals as well as tourists, so it's great for people-watching. You can walk to restaurants and bars as well as stores like American Apparel, American Eagle Outfitters, two vintage clothing stores and souvenir shops. Mel's Drive In is literally right around the corner. I actually just got back from my stay. I went with my sister and her son. Getting past the location, which was excellent, the motel itself wasn't exactly wonderful. It looks good from the outside -- it's in a pretty nice area of Hollywood -- but it's a Motel 6. There are stains on the carpet in the hall and the elevator takes forever to arrive. But, the room was clean and adequate for our needs. For $10 a day you can park underground, and the attendant (wearing a white button-down shirt and vest) will bring you a wheeled luggage carrier. Best of all, they allow pets, which was my No. 1 priority. AND it's inexpensive. With the one night of lodging, pet fee ($10) and parking fee, it was $90. And you should know that's a steal in this area. If you're looking for a place to rest your head for a night or a weekend, I recommend Motel 6 Hollywood. If you're coming to LA and plan to spend a lot of time in the room on some kind of extended getaway, I'd look elsewhere. Honestly, this is a good place to stay in the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Hell? Naw...”
Reviews.Author: Greedo2kand8
Reviews.Content: Contrary to many of the posted reviews, I found the Motel 6 a reasonably-priced option in Hollywood, and there are plenty of options! It has a great location, just 1/2 block up from HollyBlvd, and, yeah, some of the employees are young-ish, and the place is not new, but it is a pretty cool old building in a cool neighborhood. I found the staff very helpful, there's parking down at the corner if your car doesn't fit in the garage, and they reimbuse you for it. Yeah there's all kind and manner of critter rompin' 'round on Hollywood Blvd., but we had no problems. The weirdest thing I saw was a guy sleeping in a storm drain, I mean, the things are huge!

Reviews.Title: “Price is Right - Location is Right”
Reviews.Author: i_heart_roadtrips
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an inexpensive place to stay within walking distance to Hollywood Blvd and all of it's glory, this is the place. We stay here every time we go to Hollywood, which is a lot. We have encountered some 'characters' here, but nothing scarey. We walk down Hollywood Blvd late at night and have never had a problem. There's a wonderful pizza place (Al Forno) right around the corner also. We've walked to the Music Box Theatre for concerts, over to Amoeba for music, down to the Chinese Theater...everything within walking distance. The price is right, we've slept well every time, the architecture is beautiful...especially that building right across the street. Maybe not a place for someone with small kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not a Patel Hell either”
Reviews.Author: TeufelWolf
Reviews.Content: Many of the negatives mentioned by other reviewers can be true here, but it is a Motel 6 in an urban area. I've stayed at other budget motel in Hollywood, and YOU will generally get more service here (such as free ice, pets allowed, free local calls w/o a deposit). This can be a party motel. I often use it with friends to have a place to go to after clubbing in Hollywood that doesn't require driving or a cab.
